Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaBob77
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 5 days at this hotel and although only 3 stars it was a perfect loation.Everything about this hotel is basic BUT the bedding and bathroom were spotless.You have to decide what you want from a holiday and we wanted location as we were out walking everyday.The breakfast is basic but enough to keep you going for the morning. The receptionists were not particularly friendly but so what. All we can say is that is a must to see Rome and this is a reasonable hotel to stay at. Linda and Bob...... England

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for. Cheap, but god location”
Reviews.Author: Danish_Greetings
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome in the winterholliday (week 7) and just wanted a simple hotel in central spot. This is what you get: It's cheap. It's very simple Worn down Cold in the winter (took us a day to heat up the room) Breakfast is typically Italien, very simple (however, the coffee for Italian standard sucks) But Things works Very centally located. I guess it's but like buing a house, locatio, locatio, location. So in conclusion. Only go here if you have simple expectations and don't plan to spend time at the hotel beside for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Ruins in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Our Agent booked this for us, not till I had a look on tripadvisor did I fear the worst, but since it was just a place to sleep thought cant be that bad ............. On level 5 stayed there 4 nights, very large room, family of 4, so far so good, breakfast was pretty ordinary (but not as bad as some reviews), the shower was mmmmm, how can I put it mmmmmm, either very cold (fresh to say the least) or stinking hot (loss weight by burning off a layer of skin when using), I brought to their attention every day it wasnt till the day before we left they tried to fix but still didnt work as it should have, didnt risk allowing kids have a shower. Our room had an internal lock, but didnt work as above brought to their attention (Yep, will get someone to look, they may have looked but didnt fix it !), very noise location as on a main street, We walked everywhere so to be honest location didnt really add any value, you get what you pay for - not what we were used to but it did seem clean, but very old and to be fair to owners I dont think they truely understand the needs of the customers ??

Reviews.Title: “David Bristol”
Reviews.Author: david m
Reviews.Content: Dont book this hotel not only is it dusty and dirty with holes in the sheets,but it is a safety hazzard with faulty plugs and sockets and mould in the bathroom.The entrace lobby is dimly lit cold and uninviting like the staff such a shame as Rome is such a beautiful city.On the plus there are plenty of other cleaner safer hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it.....”
Reviews.Author: Irene A
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews..the place is horrible. This place has seen better days. If you're lucky you will manage to have a hot shower. I have no clue how they managed to make it look so amazing on their website but whoever did the website must have spent endless hours photoshoping! We were too scared to switch on the AC so i'm not sure if they work. The only advantage is the location cause it is very central and close to the metro and all the main attractions. The breakfast is as dry as Gandhi's sandles......but its cheap you get exactly what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “terrible place ...cheap though!”
Reviews.Author: Artur A
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing of this Hotel is their shiny website. No idea how they managed to shoot these photos, but most probably not without photoshopping them or making photos of different locations! The whole hotel is shabby and run down. The breakfast is really horrible (dry rolls > 2 days old, Processed, plastic packked cheese slices and terrible ham). My room had the air condition of the whole hostel clos to its window so it sounded like sleeping on the street, the room of my friend had huge water/moist spots on its walls

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel you get what you pay for, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: caseycouple
Reviews.Content: Was slightly concerned before arriving due to having read a number of bad reviews. In reality this hotel was basic and dated but it is also clean, tidy and in a brilliant location. We stayed in march 2010 and used the hotel as a base to explore the city we were rarely in the hotel because there is so much to see in and around Rome! would recommend for those needing a cheap base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,the rest was bad”
Reviews.Author: Roar L
Reviews.Content: Great location, but noisy with window out to via Nazionale. Grumpy,mostly asian staff that did not lift their eyes for a buon giorno. Very simple breakfast table, with one 2 kinds of ham, plasticpacked cheese,honey, jam and jelly in portion packs. Not to tasteful coffee from an automat. Noisy aircondition and fan. Not too clean all around.Hard,uncomfortable beds. +for repairing the toilet-seat

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for low price in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PaulB239
Reviews.Content: The sign claims 3 star, but it is not. It was only 100 Euros when other 2 star hotels were more. It is very old and the street noise is bad if room faces the main street. It is close to the train station which makes it good for walking to if arriving by train from the airport. The breakfast was o.k., but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Flea pit of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minsteryork
Reviews.Content: I never write review like this but felt that others hould be made aware of what they might be walking into when arranging a special trip to the fabulous city of Rome. We booked this through Jet2 Holidays and payed premium rate for for 3star accommodation!!!!!! This hotel nearly ruined our experience there - we opened the door and were in shock. Scruffy bedding - with what appeared 'orange crate' bits to hold the bed up. Wallpaper torn and skirting boards hanging off the wall. Nothing matched. Furniture was random and the kind of stuff you'd walk past at a car boot fair. We went straight out to find alternative accommodation and after visiting 6 other hotels (who told us we were a family of many to come straight out of the Repubblica after seeing it) we managed to book another hotel for the 2nd and 3rd night of our stay in Rome. The reception of the Repubblica was a disgrace and very untidy and unclean. The lift which you'd never know takes you to the other floors is like stepping in a swinging double wardrobe. The whole staircase was in the open air, making it extremely cold and windy. If you're looking for anywhere clean, comfortable where you at least may rest your weary head - don't book here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Clare-Marie_93
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews for this hotel, I arrived expecting a broken down, dangerous, unsafe, unclean and hostile hostel. Upon actually arriving, I couldn't believe how wrong I was! I have stayed in quite a few hotels around Italy and this was one of my favourites - I shared my room with three fellow students and it was very clean and neat, large, and perfectly sufficient for a city stay! It even had a working television - not that anyone had any time to watch it! I went with a group of over twenty students sharing in rooms of four and we were all impressed - it was much, much better than any hostel! I dreaded the thought of having a broken and dirty shower and packed with the expectation of having to 'rough' it, but the bathroom was lovely! The shower worked well, with hot and cold water, and it was all very hygienic. There was a good cleaning service too, which I didn't expect! The view from my window was wonderful (I stayed in the room with the American flag outside the window - I can't remember the room number!) and the beds were clean and comfortable, in fact, I slept better than I do here in England! I have no idea why other reviews complain of a horrible smell, none of us noticed anything unusual. Although the hotel is on a busy street and I could hear the sounds of the city all night, it did not disturb my sleep (and I'm a light sleeper) at all; when you've spent 8 hours a day footing it around Rome, sleep really isn't difficult! For the money, breakfast service is absolutely fine also. I'd also like to say that security is perfectly fine - no students had any incidents of theft, although we didn't take anything of particular value other than cameras. I dread what people had said about the 'dodgy 1950s lift', but actually it looked quite nice in my opinion and worked fine! If you're looking for a luxury, glisteningly modern hotel, intend to spend most of the day within it, and dread ripped wall paper or damaged wall paintings, then this isn't the place for you. However, if you've come to Rome to see the amazing sights of the eternal city and need a hotel to shower and sleep comfortably in, then Repubblica hotel is ideal! As a student, it's fantastic - 24/7 reception, plenty of places to eat and drink around, brilliant location. I think I was lucky enough to get the best room in the hotel when comparing it to other students' rooms who were in my group, but the worst to fear is a bit of shabbiness and that's all! I hope you enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: JemCollins
Reviews.Content: After reading the various reviews on this website I was highly dubious about a forthcoming stay in this hotel. The feeling of trepidation as I entered the doors were enormous. The rooms were large and though not recently decorated (paint peeling slightly), were clean and well stocked with bedding and clean towels. The bathroom was also clean and the showers were hot at all times. The rooms came with travel plug adapters for all countries. Breakfast was adequate, yet still better than expected. Consisted of Coffee, Juice, Meats, Rolls, Croissants, Cake and Cereals - Really not bad for the price! Also Free Wifi in the reception, which was very handy and check in was 24 hours. Having read reports of stolen goods, we took all valuables with us, but this would probably be standard practice, nothing stolen from whole group. Staff spoke good English and quick to sort problem. Lift looked like something out of the sixites, but once you got in it worked fine! Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Peadug Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the views on Trip Advisor I was not expecting much from this hotel but it was surprisingly clean and comfortable and was good value for money. Despite a central location our room was not noisy and we slept well. An intitial problem with the bathroom was sorted out speedily. The breakfast was average but adequate. I would stay here again if in Rome on business. A good reminder not to be put off by other's comments.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this hotel is the website”
Reviews.Author: Renim11
Reviews.Content: WOW! Prior to going I had read reviews that said it was dirty. I was apprehensive. Not sure it was as dirty as it was old and in great need of renovation. The wall paint was atrocious in yellow/orange faux paint. The pictures were brown water stained. The stairwell wall was peeling and in need or repair. The bedside table glass was broken. Furniture was old, chipped, closet coming apart. There was a wall plug at the end of the shower that was coming off and you could see the wires behind. Not a comforting thought if you took a shower.....so we didn't. Yucky! Day staff was very friendly. Night staff not so much. Looks like they remodeled the first floor. Haven't progressed any higher. Good location but needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: airyariel
Reviews.Content: i travelled to rome with a large group of people from school. our tour guide was good friends with the owner of the hotel and assured us that it was a 3 star hotel.... it was FAR from it. to get to the lobby, we first had to climb two sets of stairs (one set brought you to hotel augustea's lobby). from there, the we had to check in at the very cramped lobby. after check-in, we had the option of taking a run-down lift and climbing the ridiculous marble stairs. the lift couldfit no more than two people and their belongings. i went up on the lift and i feared for my life! once getting to the rooms, we found that they were very unkept and some doors didn't even lock. that night we went out on a walking tour of the city and upon returning, a bunch of people's things had been stolen out of their rooms including ipods and cameras. while in rome, i came down with strep throat. we were on our way to dinner after spending the day touring the city when i decided i was going to head back to the hotel and rest. my roommate had the key and i only realized this after returning. much to my dismay, when i asked the woman at the desk if she had a spare key, she said no. she explained to me that her boss had all of the spare keys in his office which was locked because he was out of town. i could not believe it. I DON NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “tatty, old fashioned, scary”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirelass_520
Reviews.Content: unfortunately our accomodation was booked and paid for BEFORE any reviews were read. The photos here are not hotel Repubblica, they are hotel Augustea which shares the same entrance, you go up a flight of stairs and are faced with two hotel receptions. The bedding and room was clean but very very shabby, broken furniture, TV not working, torn wallpaper. We had 4 mish mashed coat hangers from various shops for a double room. Breakfast was totally inexcusable, cups stuck to plastic table clothes, stale pastries and rolls, no dessert spoons, had to eat cereal with a teaspoon! no glasses, just white plastic disposable cups. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: angrygirl68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sadly recommended by a travel agent, but the location is the ONLY redeeming feature! The exterior is dirty and unkempt, and there is a small broken neon sign with the hotel name written in Chinese.. for whom this hotel is aimed. You are forced to carry your bags up a flight of stairs before waiting for a slow, dangerous lift. The lobby is on the first floor... dirty and unkempt. The hotel I think is owned by a huge italian whom I nicknamed the fat controller, but we saw him a few times, and otherwise the hotel is essentially run by asians. The receptionist was the rudest, most unfriendly, sour woman I have had the pleasure of meeting. Getting information from her was like getting blood from a stone, she would ignore you if you spoke directly to her and she blatantly lied to my face on the first night, informing me that the hotel was totally booked out so that I couldn't swap from my revolting room. The manager refuted this the next morning. Never were any of my complaints dealt with. She virtually ignored me for 4 days. My room was on the third floor at the end of a corridor. (Meanwhile - the numbers on you hotel key are written in biro and stuck on with sticky tape!!) I was in a single room. It was small, smelly and furnished with numerous items which appeared to have been bought in flea markets. I had a lopsided bed, and a fridge that looked to be atleast 40 years old with no shelves left in it and mould growing inside. There was no chair and the sheets were not changed for the 4 days that we were there. The bathroom was the worst. Mouldy shower with water that alternated between cold and scolding, a tap that wouldn't stop leaking, a toilet paper dispenser that was the same as those used in school bathrooms, and walls that had never been cleaned. There was a drain in the middle of the room full of other people's hair and numerous fittings were falling of the walls. I felt like vomitting any time I had to enter the room... and showering - all I can say is - glad I had thongs. The breakfast was cheap and nasty. The room was filthy - and the asian girls handling our food looked as though they had just jumped out of bed. Tracksuit pants, underwear showing, hair falling in their face. The table cloths were just wiped down with ONE diry rag day after day. I cannot believe health inspectors would pass this!!! On the third day the first floor was in disarray and there was drilling all day. There were three blackouts - no explanation and the TV and airconditioning never worked again for the next 2 days.. our complaints were not answered, explained or dealt with!!! In summation - this hotel was a filthy, rotten, revolting excuse for accommodation... and in no way whatsoever, feigned or official was it three star quality. I was staying essentially in hostel quality accommodation and paying unacceptably high three-star rates. I have researched the rating system in Italy and found that there is very little, if no regulation which does not suprise me. I am still in disbelief at the conditions I was forced to endure and I feel that something needs to be done about it!! Final comment - book at you own peril! You have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Security.”
Reviews.Author: Gennel
Reviews.Content: A first when you can access a room sraight from the STREET without going through reception. Point proved when camera stolen from friends room. Little interest from management. Breakfast - it would be kind to say it was basic. Go at your peril but certainly leave nothing valuable in your room.

Reviews.Title: “The so called Repubblica hotel. Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: ThailandReddevil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, in my life. The condition was that of a concentration camp. Rude, un-helpful staff. Health and safety would shut this place down if it were in the UK. The lift was pre-historic and dangerous. The room doors had obviously been forced open and they were not secure. The air conditioning did not work. The so called mini bars were full of dust and the rooms had obviously not been cleaned for a while. Even after the stay the hotel was emailing asking for credit card details to take further inflated credit card payments for a higher price than agreed at the time of booking. A place to be avoided, it looks nothing like the photos advertising the hotel. Red Devil

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever I stayed”
Reviews.Author: raira
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel during Easter time, Location was excellent but others such as hotel room cleanliness, staff attitude, and elevater. Our playing card was stolen and we reported to the reception, his attitude was really bossy and he said it was just a playing card. yes it was just a card but which was STOLEN. On the same day when Chinese lady was having a breakfast at hotel. her bag was stolen, she lost her money and passport. so I told the receptionist that there is a thief in this hotel and he was so mad. I will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever come across”
Reviews.Author: Traveller880
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel staff were the most unfriendly, rude and useless people I have ever come across. We requested a cot with several months notice and when we arrived there was no cot to be seen. When a cot eventually arrived it was unsuitable for an animal to sleep in nevermind our 18month old son. We didn't risk having breakfast after seeing the state of the breakfast room and felt like we were risking our lives everytime we used the ancient lift. To top the whole experience off when we disputed our bill at the end of our stay the hotel manager said it wasn't his problem and went ahead and took the money from my credit card without my authorisation!

Reviews.Title: “I'm not picky... this was one of the worst hotels i've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: dizzkat
Reviews.Content: The location is basically the only good thing about this hotel. Lots of shopping, cafes & grocery store on the same street. There's a McDonalds right next door. That's where we had breakfast mostly since the hotel's looked gross. The room was a decent size with a nice little balcony. There was an awful smell coming from the bathroom... it smelled like sewage. We had to go buy a can of air freshner since and it helped a little. But we had to used it every hour it was so bad. The bathroom towels were so weird. They were oversized dish towels. So thin and small compared to a regular bath towel. The worst part is they have several teenage groups stay here pretty much unsupervised. The yelling and slamming of doors etc... went on ALL night long. We complained several times and even asked them to be quiet, but that made it worse. I don't know how these kids can go all day & night with no sleep. It only got quiet after 8am when they all left on their field trips. If stinky rooms and loud teenagers don't bother you, then it you'll love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: crazy_maria
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I didn't read all these horrible reviews before my trip to Rome or we wouldn't have stayed here. We arrived in Rome with a list of hotels and no reservations. After walking around past numerous hotels that were either sold out or over 200 euros, we stumbled on Hotel Republica. We asked to see the room before accepting and was a little put off by the hardness of the bed but choose to stay here as we were tired of searching. We really had no problems whatsoever with our stay. The "hard" bed was actually fine to sleep on - not uncomfortable surprisingly. The room was huge (we had a triple) with high (15 foot plus ceilings). Decor was a little dated but room and bathroom were very clean. There is some noise from outdoors but after a busy day in Rome, we had no trouble falling asleep. Breakfast was a variety of pastries and meats, cereal and yogurt - actually a better assortment than most hotels we stayed at during our two weeks in Italy. All-in-all this was a pretty good deal for the price (150 euro) in a city know for expensive hotels. Hotels was also right on the main bus (64) route to St. Peters and within a couple blocks of the Trevi Fountain. Victor Emmanuel building can be seen from Via Nazionale which runs in front of hotel and Forum and Colosseum a short walk down that street also. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean cheap hotel and is not looking for anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Puzza beyond fantasy!”
Reviews.Author: freya_thess
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days and these were the most disgusting ones of my life...I'll give you examples.The first day that we went to that hotel our bathroom's drain trap was dripping.Their breakfast is awful , The only fresh thing here is coffee.And the most awful thing of all is the smell of vinegar.Even the bed linen was reeking of vinegar.Probably they wash them with vinegar in order to kill bacteriums..But they haven't discover detergent?Maybe vinegar is cheaper...I couldn't sleep from this awful smell...Their elevator has problem and wait from anyone to move your laggages to your rooms,you will do it yourself!Stay away from this hotel!Is full of PUZZA (=awful smell in Italian)

Reviews.Title: “Lose valuables and spoil your trip”
Reviews.Author: Halton_1
Reviews.Content: While on a school trip my daughter and her friends left for dinner and cameras and ipods worth over 2500 were stolen from their locked room. The staff was unresponsive. We have a police report and have tried to contact them repeatedly but they will not repond. I am appalled at the lack of security while housing teenagers. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotels get Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: i_am_me_55
Reviews.Content: - I as well was on the group trip and all of this is true. The stolen items from a room that locked was the worst thing that happened and I was appalled at the response from the people at reception. - The elevator was extremely old and could only hold one person with luggage, so it takes a while to get to your room on the fifth floor when so many are using it. - The worst shower I have ever had..hot then cold then all over again. The toilet leaked..so the bathroom floor was always wet. And our bathroom window didn't stay shut, it opened on its own. - In my room, a friend of mine went to put her things in the fridge, it was wet so she pulled her things out, and she said it smelled weird. Then she realized her jeans had white spots on them from what was in the fridge..figured it must be bleach and after smelling it, it was. So she complained to them and they claimed it must have been the people before! Ya right, the people before us decided to rub bleach in the fridge. Two words - B S - The breakfast was as horrible as the service and hotel rooms which comes as no surprise really. - My advice, don't risk it.

Reviews.Title: “Take one look, then run for the exits!”
Reviews.Author: P_Dawg_8
Reviews.Content: I also was part of the group who had possessions stolen from their room during their stay at this hotel. The staff there was unresponsive until the police arrived. Only then did the hotel take the break in as somewhat serious. The rooms were, to say the least, spartan and lacking in most areas. The showers either scalded you or left you freezing. The shower in my room leaked all over the floor and was in serious need of repair. Several student groups(boys soccer teams) were allowed to run wild in the hotel until well past 2AM and the staff did nothing when we registered our complaints. Not to point fingers, but the room broken into was locked before leaving for dinner. Someone either gained access to the room key from the front desk, or there are pass keys floating around. The location was handy, but I would check other hotels in the area before staying here. It would be well worth paying a few Euros extra to stay in a safer, cleaner and more secure hotel. I would not stay at this hotel again...even for free.

Reviews.Title: “4000$ STOLEN”
Reviews.Author: happykid123
Reviews.Content: First of all NEVER EVER stay here if you want to keep your valuables. I went with a school group and $4000 worth of cameras and Ipods were stolen from our rooms. We left them there for ONE HOUR while we grabbed a bite to eat , and when we came back they were gone. The front desk LAUGHED and were NO HELP WATSOEVER. As soon as the clerk lady found out about the stolen materials SHE LEFT. They couldn't speak English at all. Breakfast was a dry croissant, or a roll.. Oh you could've had the water-juice or instant coffee. The bathroom knob broke and no one came to fix it. The water pressure was TERRIBLE and the temperature went from ICE COLD to SCORTCHING.A 94 year old elevator that has never been upgraded ( no exaggeration) . Overall: DO NOTTTT STAYYY HEERREEE, DISCUSTINGG!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ruskenEastlander
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife was in Rome for the first time and was looking for a averrage hotel to a low cost. (We believe strongly In Rome is not the hotel the most importent). Repubblica Hotel is sentral, nice price and very good in every way.......The staff was polite, ordinary breakfast with bread, ham, jelly, coffy, tea, juice and some sveet cakes. The room was clean, the bath likewise. New towels everyday of couse. We had room at the top of the building with a small balkony. Very nice. We recommend this hotel for couples who`s in Rome for walking the streets, look at the city and need a nice place to rest their feet, take a bath and have a safe good night sleep. It is not a luxuary hotel, but who need that in Rome??? We don`t.. Ottar and Annie (Norway)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this death-hole!”
Reviews.Author: TiredShoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely unacceptable. We checked in with a large group and spent one horrible night before moving on to something else--anything would have been better. It was filthy, it stank, and there was no running water in the showers. Stay away from this awful place at all costs! I don't mind traveling cheap and am quite comfortable in low budget but I can't abide by the absolute pit this place was.

Reviews.Title: “stuck here”
Reviews.Author: HouTrav
Reviews.Content: I was put at this hotel by Hotel Sonya after they told me they couldn't accomodate me, even though I had a reservation. The Hotel Repubblica reception desk is on an upper floor of an obsure building. My room was small, dark and the entire place is very old. The bathroom smelled and was one of the smallest I've every been in. No light in the room and the whole place had the atmosphere of a brothel or flop house. The television nor heater worked. When complaining to the front desk, the manager insisted that the heater did work. It was freezing in the room all night. Thankfully it was only a one night stay and I moved on. This is not a hotel to have any kind of a vacation in. Only a place to sleep if you are desparate for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and dirty Repubblica! Filthy.”
Reviews.Author: liveaid
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the photos online that make it seem like its ok. the entrance is shady and you have to go in ridiculously tiny claustrophobic elevator or carry your luggage up the stairs to get to the lobby. Since our room wasnt ready we had to leave our luggage in the deposit room. They gave us the key and we realized there was no safety or control over the bags left there. It was a real dump, like the rest of the hotel. The bathroom shower was covered in green and black fungus...absolutely disgusting. The entire room felt like a big toilet. Unfortunately we read the critics after we had made the reservation online. And we didnt want to believe all we read was true, so please for your own sake and the rest of tourists, do not give more money to this hotel. If you really want your money´s worth and in the same location, across the street one block up we found Martini Hotel. Wonderful stay, clean and charming hosts. Other terrible hotels we experienced in Rome are: Midi, Giolitti and Luisa- they are all run by the same receptionists in Midi hotel. Their location was far and the staff was rude to the point of cursing us out.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, its not THAT bad!”
Reviews.Author: matlack616
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we booked this hotel in early September mainly because of the price. A few days before we left for Italy in November I started reading horrific reviews for this hotel. I was nervous and expected the worse. Honestly, its really not that bad. Our package was VERY affordable. The hotel is VERY run-down (wallpaper peeling, pictures from the 30's, etc), but our room was clean. I am a neat-freak, I even brought my own sheets because of the reviews, but I did not need them. It's a European Hotel at a budget price, what were you expecting? We were traveling to Europe to see the sites, not to hang out in the hotel all day. The breakfast is not great (rolls, warm yougart, croissant) but in Italy they do not eat like we do here in America (you will not find pancakes, sausage, home fries). Really, if you already booked this hotel... do not worry, I am very picky and had no problems. We went to visit a friend that was studying abroad and she shared thousands of stories about terrible European hotels..but she said they all eventually feel like home. On day 1 I didnt believe her, but by the middle of the week- I had agreed. The only station we got in English was MTV, but the t.v worked fine. The maids came every day and cleaned everything (I saw it). The shower water was either scorching hot or freezing, but I had that problem previously in a variety of hotels (just make it a quick one). If you are looking for luxury, you have to pay a higher price. We wanted affordable, and we got it. Also, its in a good location..steps from 2different metro stops (Repubblica and Termini) and very close to the Trevi Fountain (my favorite site in Rome). Rome is incredibly unimpressive, my best advice is to make your trip short but not because of the hotel! Make sure you get to Venice...it was amazing. Hope this helped. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: officialregistrar
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel in Rome. We stayed in two small singles. They were air conditioned and had refurbished bathrooms. The lift is very old and you have to wait a lot. The breakfast is poor. It consists of coffee from a coffee machine and a choice of two rolls. Orange juice is also supplied by a machine. Not really worth having. The rooms were clean and the bed linen good. A good option for the budget traveller but don't expect any luxury.

Reviews.Title: “staff to be more approachable”
Reviews.Author: villasis
Reviews.Content: staffs in reception are not helpful/approachable,room for single is too small,food needs more stuff, bathroom is too old,cleanliness -ok,theres only 1 lift for all the occupants,old type of lift,location was ok,all in all not recommended

Reviews.Title: “A New Low In Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ShariEnZihua
Reviews.Content: Since we were getting into Rome at such a late hour, I booked this hotel as it was close to the termini and economical as we were only going to "crash for the night", I figured we could put up with "run down". We were supposed to catch a train the following morning for Venice, but our luggage didn't make it. Arriving at 12:30 AM, there was an Asian man behind the desk who did have our reservation for a standard double room. We were given the key and he pointed to the elevator which had me saying prayers for the first time in a long time. It was about as big as an airplane lavatory and looked ancient. We entered our double room to find four cots that had pillows the thickness of a padded envelope, bottom and top sheets with thin bedspreads. The wall paper was torn from the walls. The minibar was appearently being used to grow some sort of fungus. The shower had hot and cold water, you just never knew when or how much you'd get of either. I returned to the desk at 9:30 and explained to the Asian girl now manning the desk that our luggage would be delivered sometime early that afternoon. I told her I understood check out was at 10:30 and asked if we could arrange for a half day rate while we waited for our luggage. "Sure," she said, "half the rate". OK, there's another 65 Euro. Went upstairs to give my husband the "good news" and then we ventured out around 11 to find something to eat and look around. We returned to the hotel around 2:30 in the afternoon and was told our luggage did not arrive. I got out the lost luggage form and called British Airways who told me they tried to deliver our luggage but were told that we checked out! After pleading with BA to please bring the bags back they said they would see what they could arrange and call me back. Great. So now I ask Asian man #2 if he can put the call thru to our room, "No problem", he tells me. Up to the room. Phone doesn't work. No dial tone. Yes it's plugged in. Back down to the office. I'm told there's no technician to fix the phone. Fine. Call BA back, yes, they'll bring the bags back and will be there in about 30 minutes. Back upstairs to relay the plan to husband. I decided to lay down for a little nap and my husband, not too trusting of the front desks' capabilities of receiving two pieces of luggage from a driver, goes down to wait. Sure enough, they've told the driver he can't park in front of the hotel (for 7 minutes to drop off bags) so my husband has to meet the driver about a block and a half to retrieve the bags. I'm still stunned but getting over it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ATLgirl
Reviews.Content: Not so much a hotel, but a portion of a floor in a building- several rooms run by a family as a hotel. It gets only 2 stars on Rome's strict grading system. However- for the price, and for the location, and for the authenticity, we really really enjoyed it. The room was small but big enough, the decor was sparce but sufficient. We had a huge window that looked out into the alley way and onto the street. We loved that. The air conditioning worked but we didn't need it, and the little tv was fine (but in Italian, of course). You cannot raise your hands above your head in the shower- but hey, welcome to Italy. There is a tiny elevator that serves the several "hotels" in the building, but we used stairs. The location near the main train station is great. The hotel gives you a coupon for breakfast consisting of a bun and expresso at a nearby cafe. Worked just fine for us. We really liked the neighborhood. We would definitely stay there again. But if you're looking for luxury- or even American style comfort, don't say I didn't warn you. Speaking of warnings, I'll give two: #1: Be careful especially in the train station. My friend had her wallet taken from her purse (though we managed to chase down the pickpocket and get it back, amazingly enough). and #2: Almost the entire city of Rome is made of marble. Beautiful but SLIPPERY WHEN WET!

Reviews.Title: “The most gawdawful dump I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: crotalusBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: I travel a LOT. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Ever. For 120 Euros a night, this place is a sad joke. The staff are all chinese, and speak neither English nor Italian well. The room - allegedly three-star -- was dirty, tired and had been furnished in the days of Mussolini. Nothing worked. The air conditioner sounded like a B17. The toilet seat was coming off its hinges. The street noise was deafening. a TOTAL rip offf; you can do much better in Rome for less money. Avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews were so negative, we were satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: lorlafayette
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a horrible hotel and staff after reading all the negative reviews. We almost cancelled our reservation. We were delightfully surprised. The reason you stay here is the location. It is a two star hotel, but the water was hot, clean room, etc. The staff was very nice to us. They do speak english, italian and mandarin. The breakfast is just like the reviews said: coffee from a machine, over sweet juice, croissant, ham luncheon meat, etc. The hotels in Italy are not the five star Four Seasons or Ritz. Definately not as bad as stated in the reviews! I would stay here again because of the fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yeah, It was among the lowest hotel experiences, but definitly not the worst. The room was very simple as was the bathroom. I got warm water every day so I didn't face such problems with cold showers as the earlier comments says. I was lucky to have quiet room in the courtyard side, so the traffic did not cause any problem during the nigths. As earlier posts say, the fridge didn't work in my room either and I think the air conditioning is not proper during the warmer months. Now AC was ok - it wasn't cold at least. The personnel cleaned the room daily and the rooms were not dirty. The sheets were propably not changed every day, but they were at least clean once I arrived. The location is very good as the hotel lies in walking distance to nearly every Rome's key sights. The personnel was polite, but the service was nothing special. And the breakfast was really poor as earlier said. Somebody said it is normal European breakfast, but I can assure it is not. It is far from normal decent breakfast! Hotel is definetly not a three star hotel if compared to any *** hotel in European city. So, if you find hotel with same price and same location, don't go here. If you expect average or above average service, don't go here. If breakfast is part of your daily program, don't go here. If you don't care so much about the hotel while travelling and if the price is good, then you survive here too. PS. Funny thing about the hotel's web-site. The picture on the first page is taken nearby, but the building in the photo is definetely not the Hotel Repubblica. Infact, in that building operates very good 4-5 star hotel...which is not the Repubblica.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Bill1950_10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel and were totally disappointed and disgusted. Whenever you used the shower or toilet, fluid bubbled up from the floor waste. The rooms smelled terrible. The sheets were stained and appeared to be dirty. The heating was not working. When we complained we were ignored. We were supposed to stay 5 nights but left after 2. A real flea pit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: beaboop
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome just 2 weeks ago for a 2 night stay. I had no reservations and ended up at this hotel. I checked in, went up to the room and then checked out. I knew I was in trouble when the air freshener did not cover the terrible ordor. The room was dirty and the bathroom was filthy. On each floor there is a room with a few couches, chairs, coffee tables. I felt like I was in a house of ill repute and the working girls were going to come out at any moment. I ended up going around the corner to a best western, which was a bit more expensive but well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of Repubblica Hotel before going to Rome, which led me to take my own sheets. No need...the hotel was just like any other European 3 star hotel. It was old, yes, however it's Rome!! Everything's old in Rome. It had a bed, a shower in a clean bathroom, a full length mirror, and a TV. The room was not dingy or dirty like some of the reviews stated. The maids cleaned it everyday, as is expected. There was a place downstairs to store your luggage in case you wanted to check in early or check out and then tour the city before catching the train to the airport. The train station was at the corner just steps from the hotel, there was a bus stop right outside, and the hotel is on one of the main streets in Rome! What more could you ask for for such a low price? If you are planning on going to Rome to see the hotel, don't stay at the Repubblica, because it's basic. I went to Rome to see Rome therefore the Repubblica served my needs quite nicely. As a bonus, 2 blocks down from the hotel (on the Via Delle Quattro Fontane) I ate the best pizza I have ever eaten at a restaurant called Berzitello. My husband ate some of their pasta and he was thrilled with it. There is also a fabulous restaurant directly next door to the hotel. As for breakfast, it was a traditional European breakfast...bread, ham, and jellies. It was not a huge spread, but it was good! I recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a place to lay their head while enjoying Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, depressing pit”
Reviews.Author: neilEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty - the public rooms are dirty and the bedrooms more so, the bathroom showers are disgusting with peeling mildewed sealant. The aircon doesn't seem to work. Breakfast is vile and the room and utensils involved are to be avoided! Good location but there are real reasons to avoid!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a pit.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel under any circumstances. The room I stayed was filthy: I slept fully dressed because the bed was so dirty. To be honest, I didn't feel safe either. And the location isn't that great. So what if it's near Termini? Via Nazionale doesn't have much charm, especially late at night. The next morning I went to the hotel reservation desk at Termini where they booked me into another 3-star hotel at the same price, but it was a palace compared to the Repubblica. So even if you're desperate, you can find a better place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Hotel Repubblica at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay away from the Hotel Repubblica in Rome! I will never recommend to anyone to stay at the Hotel Repubblica in Rome! Our room definitely did not meet its 3-star rating. The fridge and the air conditioning did not work. The water in the shower went from cold to very hot so we had to step out of the shower and then get back in. I reported all this(in Italian and English) to the manager who said that it was going to be taken care of. When I told him the next day that nothing had been fixed he acted surprised and said it would be fixed. Needless to say, nothing was done by the time we left. Also, the plaster on one wall was falling off and the bathroom hardly had any space to put our toiletries on. Stay away from this hotel and the others in the same building (they've combined them into one)!

Reviews.Title: “The FLYING hotel Repubblica”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Though the staff was courteous and our room was clean, we couldn't help but notice, though, that the building moved constantly. We felt like we were in the old Montgomery Ward building which was built on rollers in case of an earthquake. We spent one night and were happy to leave safely. Apparently the building has settled significantly over the years as the stairs were uneven. We were on the fifth floor.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The World of Vacation recommended it to me and it was TERRIBLE. Dirty ( with cockroaches), broken latches, staff pretended that they do not speak English, etc. D

HotelInfo.Name: Repubblica Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale 251, 00184 Rome, Italy
